Endlessly expanding technology

When stuff just works...

Don’t you just love it when things just work?  Tonight, I was working with some code that I’d written a short while ago, but never tested or tried it out.  Figured I should make it works (as it was needed for my next part), and after a quick runtime error in the skin file (missing reference), the page loaded, did my thing, it posted back (with fingers crossed and covering my eyes except for a small crack between the fingers), and it actually worked.  Its always a great feeling when that happens. :)

Wednesday, April 27, 2005

About

This is the personal blog of Ken Robertson. I'm a developer at Involver working in Ruby/Rails. In a former life, I worked in .NET for many years and since moved on.

Now, I get to make Rails scale, cook all day long with chef, and experiment with building highly concurrent systems.

In my spare time, I like to build things. I like to experiment with different technologies to find how they best fit onto my utility belt.

I sometimes blog. You'll find those things here.

I sometimes code. You'll find those on Github.
